DataElement.preferredName: Patient Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Diagnosis Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator related to the diagnosis of disease recurrence and/or progression following a platinum-based chemotherapy regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnosis of disease recurrence and/or progression following a platinum-based chemotherapy regimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Platinum Compound Chemotherapy Regimen Recurrent Disease Disease Progression Diagnosis
Property.preferredDefinition: Inorganic compounds which contain platinum as the central atom.:No Value Exists:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Cancer that continues to grow or spread.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: A chemotherapy compound that contains a platinum atom. Platinum compounds do not contain alkyl groups but do cause DNA crosslinks and adducts similar to alkylating agents. DNA crosslinks and adducts ultimately lead to the induction of apoptosis.
Any regimen that can be used for the treatment of cancer and non-neoplastic disease.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If so, was the period of time
ReferenceDocuments.description: If so, was the period of time between the last dose of platinum-based chemotherapy and the first date of recurrence (or progression) less than or equal to 6 months/26 weeks/182 days?

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013
